bangus.habitat: Coastal waters, estuaries, and brackish water environments
bangus.range: Indo-Pacific region, commonly found in Philippines and Southeast Asia
bangus.diet: Omnivore - algae, plankton, small invertebrates, and plant matter
bangus.interesting_fact: Bangus is the national fish of the Philippines and a major aquaculture species
fun_facts: Has no teeth but uses its pharyngeal mill to grind food
Can tolerate a wide range of salinity levels
Important food source and cultural symbol in the Philippines

big head carp.range: Originally Asia, now found in North America and Europe
big head carp.diet: Filter feeder - zooplankton, phytoplankton, and small particles
big head carp.interesting_fact: Can filter up to 20 gallons of water per hour
fun_facts: Considered invasive in many waterways
Can jump up to 10 feet out of water when startled
Used for biological control of algae blooms

black spotted barb.range: Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Malaysia
black spotted barb.diet: Omnivore - insects, plants, small crustaceans, and algae
black spotted barb.interesting_fact: Shows distinct black spots that intensify during breeding season
fun_facts: Active schooling fish that prefer groups
Popular in aquaculture and aquarium trade
Males develop brighter colors during spawning

catfish.habitat: Freshwater rivers, lakes, and ponds worldwide
catfish.range: Found on all continents except Antarctica
catfish.diet: Omnivore - fish, insects, crustaceans, plants, and organic matter
catfish.interesting_fact: Catfish have over 100,000 taste buds all over their body
fun_facts: Use their barbels (whiskers) to locate food in murky water
Some species can breathe air and survive out of water
Can produce electrical discharges for navigation and communication

climbing perch.habitat: Freshwater ponds, swamps, and rice fields
climbing perch.range: Southeast Asia, from India to China and Indonesia
climbing perch.diet: Carnivore - small fish, insects, worms, and crustaceans
climbing perch.interesting_fact: Can survive out of water for days and 'walk' on land
fun_facts: Uses its gill covers and pectoral fins to move on land
Can breathe air using a labyrinth organ
Often found in temporary water bodies that dry up

fourfinger threadfin.habitat: Coastal waters, estuaries, and river mouths
fourfinger threadfin.range: Indo-Pacific region, from Red Sea to Australia
fourfinger threadfin.diet: Carnivore - small fish, crustaceans, and marine worms
fourfinger threadfin.interesting_fact: Has four long threadlike rays extending from pectoral fins
fun_facts: Highly prized for its sweet, firm white meat
Can detect prey using sensitive thread-like fins
Important commercial fish in Southeast Asia

freshwater eel.habitat: Freshwater rivers and lakes, spawns in ocean
freshwater eel.diet: Carnivore - fish, crustaceans, worms, and insects
freshwater eel.interesting_fact: Travels thousands of miles to spawn in the ocean
fun_facts: Can live for decades in freshwater before returning to sea
Larvae drift with ocean currents for months
Can breathe through their skin when out of water

glass perchlet.habitat: Freshwater and brackish streams, rivers, and estuaries
glass perchlet.diet: Carnivore - small fish, insects, and crustaceans
glass perchlet.interesting_fact: Transparent body allows you to see internal organs
fun_facts: Popular in aquarium trade due to transparent appearance
Schools in large groups for protection
Can change transparency based on stress levels

goby.diet: Varied - algae, small invertebrates, and organic matter
goby.interesting_fact: Largest family of fish with over 2,000 species
fun_facts: Many species have fused pelvic fins forming a suction cup
Some species can climb waterfalls
Include the world's smallest vertebrate

gold fish.habitat: Freshwater lakes, ponds, and slow-moving rivers
gold fish.range: Originally from East Asia, now found worldwide
gold fish.diet: Omnivore - plants, insects, small crustaceans, and fish eggs
gold fish.interesting_fact: Goldfish can live for over 40 years and grow quite large in proper conditions
fun_facts: Goldfish have memories longer than 3 seconds - actually months!
They can recognize human faces and be trained to perform tricks
Originally silver-gray, gold color was selectively bred by humans

gourami.habitat: Freshwater rivers, ponds, and rice paddies in Asia
gourami.range: Southeast Asia, from India to Malaysia and Indonesia
gourami.diet: Omnivore - insects, small fish, plants, and algae
gourami.interesting_fact: Gouramis can breathe air using a labyrinth organ
fun_facts: Males build bubble nests to protect their eggs
Can survive in low-oxygen water by breathing air
Popular aquarium fish due to their peaceful nature

grass carp.diet: Herbivore - aquatic plants, grass, and algae
grass carp.interesting_fact: Can eat up to 40% of their body weight in plants daily
fun_facts: Used for biological control of aquatic weeds
Can jump up to 10 feet out of water
Requires flowing water to reproduce successfully

green spotted puffer.habitat: Brackish waters, estuaries, and mangrove areas
green spotted puffer.range: Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Malaysia
green spotted puffer.diet: Carnivore - snails, crustaceans, and small fish
green spotted puffer.interesting_fact: Can inflate their body to appear larger when threatened
fun_facts: Has a beak-like mouth that continuously grows
Needs hard foods to wear down their constantly growing teeth
Contains tetrodotoxin, making them poisonous if consumed

indian carp.range: South Asia, particularly India and Bangladesh
indian carp.diet: Omnivore - algae, aquatic plants, and small organisms
indian carp.interesting_fact: One of the most important aquaculture species in India
fun_facts: Known as 'Rohu' in local languages
Can tolerate a wide range of water conditions
Forms the backbone of carp polyculture systems

indo-pacific tarpon.habitat: Coastal waters, estuaries, and freshwater rivers
indo-pacific tarpon.range: Indo-Pacific region from East Africa to Australia
indo-pacific tarpon.interesting_fact: Can leap up to 10 feet out of water when hooked
fun_facts: Has a swim bladder that allows it to breathe air
Highly prized by sport fishermen for their fighting ability
Can tolerate both fresh and saltwater environments

jaguar gapote.habitat: Freshwater lakes, rivers, and large streams
jaguar gapote.range: Central America, from Mexico to Costa Rica
jaguar gapote.diet: Carnivore - fish, crustaceans, and aquatic insects
jaguar gapote.interesting_fact: Named for its spotted pattern resembling a jaguar
fun_facts: Highly aggressive predator with powerful jaws
Can survive in polluted waters where other fish cannot
Popular in aquaculture for its hardy nature

janitor fish.range: Originally South America, now found worldwide
janitor fish.diet: Omnivore - algae, plants, and organic debris
janitor fish.interesting_fact: Called 'janitor fish' because they clean algae from surfaces
fun_facts: Can breathe air and survive out of water for hours
Considered invasive in many tropical countries
Popular in aquarium trade as algae eaters

knifefish.diet: Carnivore - small fish, insects, and invertebrates
knifefish.interesting_fact: Can generate electrical fields for navigation and communication
fun_facts: Swim by undulating their long anal fin
Can swim backwards as easily as forwards
Use electrical discharges to 'see' in murky water

long-snouted pipefish.habitat: Seagrass beds, estuaries, and shallow coastal waters
long-snouted pipefish.diet: Carnivore - small crustaceans and fish larvae
long-snouted pipefish.interesting_fact: Males carry the eggs in a brood pouch until they hatch
fun_facts: Related to seahorses and share similar breeding behavior
Can change color to match their surroundings
Sucks up prey like a living straw

mosquito fish.range: Originally North America, now introduced worldwide
mosquito fish.diet: Carnivore - mosquito larvae, small insects, and fish fry
mosquito fish.interesting_fact: Introduced worldwide to control mosquito populations
fun_facts: Can eat up to 100 mosquito larvae per day
Gives birth to live young rather than laying eggs
Can survive in polluted water conditions

mudfish.habitat: Shallow waters, swamps, and muddy areas
mudfish.diet: Carnivore - fish, frogs, and aquatic animals
mudfish.interesting_fact: Can burrow in mud and survive dry seasons
fun_facts: Can breathe air and survive without water for months
Excellent parental care with both parents guarding young
Can move across land to find new water bodies

mullet.habitat: Coastal waters, estuaries, and freshwater rivers
mullet.range: Worldwide in tropical and temperate waters
mullet.diet: Omnivore - algae, organic matter, and small organisms
mullet.interesting_fact: Known for their spectacular jumping ability
fun_facts: Can jump up to 3 feet out of water
Have a gizzard-like stomach to grind food
Important food fish in many coastal communities

pangasius.habitat: Large rivers and deltas, particularly the Mekong River
pangasius.range: Mekong River basin in Southeast Asia
pangasius.diet: Omnivore - fish, crustaceans, mollusks, and plant matter
pangasius.interesting_fact: Pangasius is one of the most farmed fish species globally
fun_facts: Can migrate over 600 miles during spawning season
Farmed extensively in Vietnam for global export
Wild populations severely threatened by overfishing and dam construction

perch.diet: Carnivore - small fish, insects, and crustaceans
perch.interesting_fact: Has excellent vision and hunts primarily by sight
fun_facts: Can change color to match their environment
Form large schools when young, become solitary when mature
Important sport and commercial fish

scat fish.habitat: Brackish waters, estuaries, and mangrove areas
scat fish.diet: Omnivore - algae, plants, small fish, and organic matter
scat fish.interesting_fact: Can tolerate extreme changes in salinity
fun_facts: Popular aquarium fish that can live in fresh or saltwater
Has a laterally compressed, disc-shaped body
Can survive in polluted waters where other fish cannot

silver barb.diet: Omnivore - plants, algae, insects, and small organisms
silver barb.interesting_fact: Important aquaculture species in Southeast Asia
fun_facts: Fast-growing fish popular in fish farming
Can adapt to various water conditions
Schooling fish that prefer groups

silver carp.diet: Filter feeder - phytoplankton and small organisms
silver carp.interesting_fact: Famous for jumping out of water when boats pass
fun_facts: Can filter up to 20% of their body weight in plankton daily
Considered highly invasive in North American waterways
Can injure boaters by jumping into boats

silver perch.diet: Omnivore - insects, plants, and small organisms
silver perch.interesting_fact: Can produce sound by vibrating their swim bladder
fun_facts: Important native fish in Australian aquaculture
Can tolerate a wide range of water temperatures
Makes grunting sounds during breeding season

snakehead.range: Asia and Africa, introduced to some areas of North America
snakehead.diet: Carnivore - fish, frogs, small birds, and aquatic insects
snakehead.interesting_fact: Snakeheads can survive on land for several days
fun_facts: Can breathe air and move across land between water bodies
Considered invasive species in many regions
Excellent parental care with both parents guarding young

tenpounder.habitat: Coastal waters, estuaries, and shallow bays
tenpounder.range: Atlantic Ocean, Gulf of Mexico, and Caribbean
tenpounder.diet: Carnivore - small fish, crustaceans, and marine worms
tenpounder.interesting_fact: Named for their tendency to jump repeatedly when caught
fun_facts: Can leap up to 6 feet out of water
Has a complex life cycle with transparent larval stage
Popular sport fish but not valued for eating

tilapia.habitat: Freshwater lakes, rivers, and shallow streams
tilapia.diet: Omnivore - algae, aquatic plants, small fish, and invertebrates
tilapia.interesting_fact: Tilapia are excellent parents with mouth-brooding behavior
fun_facts: Parents carry eggs and fry in their mouths for protection
Can adapt to various water conditions and temperatures
One of the most important aquaculture species globally
